newsitem.title: SOUTH KOREA: S.Korea drafts insurance sector liberalising plan.
newsitem.headline: S.Korea drafts insurance sector liberalising plan.

text.p: South Korea has drafted a plan to allow the nation's top five business conglomerates, or "chaebol", to participate in the life insurance sector, the Finance and Economy Ministry said on Tuesday.
A ministry statement said the government also planned to permit banks, securities houses, private firms and individuals to set up insurance firms.
LG and Sunkyong groups to join the Samsung Group in the sector sometime this year.
Currently, Samsung is the only major chaebol which has a life insurance company under its wing.
The ministry said entry into the insurance business by banks, securities firms and others was proposed for next month.
The draft proposal has been presented to a ministry committee for approval in the near future, the statement said. The statement did not give further details.
